Content: Komodo has never focused on price,  usage of the tech is coming which will drive that naturally we see it first with delayed proof of work, we see it with the dICOs that have been done and other things that are being built like KSB.   Once there hits a critical mass of deep hodlers( won't sell no matter what because either they rely upon generating Komodo for their business or are diehards or just like the passive rewards )   It will be off to the races.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r even if 100% of the rewards are sold by everyone (quite unlikely) it is a sell pressure of 14000 KMD per day

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is small amount of daily volume

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Volume takes into account bots who use the same coins over and over again. I bet if I had 14,000 kmd a day and sold it at the right times the price would go down quite a lot over time.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the realistic amount is much less than 14000 per day

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that assume 100% of people sell 100%

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It was just a speculation .. Normally coins have some cost to create where as rewards do not.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for PoW it is true, for PoS it is normal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted 5% is at the higher end of PoS returns

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and some people consider capital utilization as an opportunity cost.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think when KMD price is $10, that is $140,000 per day of sell pressure, so it takes millions per day of volume to absorb it. At $1 prices, the sell pressure is not much of an effect and during the high volume moves, 14000 coins are eaten in minutes
